A transformation is applied defined by \\( h(x) = e^{Ft}x(t) \\), where \\( F \\) is another constant matrix.

If \\( h(x) \\) is applied to a vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\dot{x}(t) = Dx(t) \\) without further intervention, will \\( x(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( x_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( \\dot{x}(t) = Dx(t) \\)?
Explanation: Applying \\( h(x) \\) initially modifies the base state vector \\( x_0 \\) into \\( e^{Ft}x(0) \\), which results in a different trajectory since the system state at t = 0 is transformed by \\( e^{Ft} \\). The evolution of \\( x(t) \\) will thus follow a different path compared to if \\( x_0 \\) had been evolved directly under \\( D \\).
